TextView.android:text: InFormSafety is an Early Childhood Education Health and Safety app which helps early childhood centres to fast track communication between staff and guardians. It provides electronic versions of existing paper-based health and safety reporting forms. Parents can view and sign off the forms electronically at any time – not just in the chaos of end-of-day pickup.

We believe this app will improve centres’ documentation of incidents, communication with parents, and compliance with regulations. We hope this will lead to better working conditions, and raise the standard of care by allowing teachers to spend more quality time with children rather than doing paperwork.

Our team, The String Pirates, are final-year Information Technology students at the Wellington Institute of Technology/Te Pūkenga. As parents of young children and former education sector workers, we want to develop an app that will enable teachers to meet their compliance requirements while allowing them to dedicate more time to children.
In version two InformSafety will build a feature where kindergarten can generate a weekly or monthly incident report with location, incident type and treatment given for the incident.
